## **Become a Member**

Your membership directly supports the GVA Visual Arts Center and ongoing programming including exhibits, classes, workshops, youth art, and more. 

 _You don’t have to be a member to take a class—but joining gives you benefits and helps our mission grow._

All memberships include special pricing on classes, a weekly e-newsletter highlighting new offerings, invitations to special events, early access to St. Simons Island Wine Festival tickets, and inclusion in the Annual Meeting & Social.

Learn more about Memberships [here](/membership).

[ Join Here ](https://donorbox.org/new-website-2025-membership-form?)

## **Donate to Enrich Our Community through Art**

Make a one-time or recurring donation to support GVA’s mission, impact, and legacy.

Note that your membership and/or contribution is tax deductible to the extent permitted by law.

_GVA is a 501(c) nonprofit supported solely by memberships, donations, sponsorships, grants and our continuing programming._

**Believe in Art**

Simply choose the amount you are comfortable giving, and it will go toward GVA’s ongoing programming. 

_Thank you in advance for your contribution!_

**Glynn Visual Arts (GVA) is committed to building a thriving arts community that nourishes our vibrant Coastal culture.**

As a nonprofit visual arts center, we celebrate and support creativity and inspiration through engaging programming and meaningful collaboration.

## _Upcoming Events_

_January 6 - February 6, 2026_

### **From the coast to the mountains**

The fine art of Thomas L. (Tom) Cato and George Netherton in their representation of three distinct landscapes. The coastline, the marshlands, and the mountain farm each offer a unique perspective for introspection in the realistic oil paintings and photography of these artists. 

**You’re Invited!:** _Join us for an opening reception Thursday, January 8, 5:30 - 7:00p.m. Free and open to the public. Light refreshments will be served._
